info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 3:45PM EDT until July 25 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR WESTERN CATAWBA...WESTERN LINCOLN...NORTH CENTRAL CLEVELAND AND SOUTHEASTERN BURKE COUNTIES... At 344 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Lenoir to 10 miles southeast of Morganton to 20 miles northeast of Forest City, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Morganton, St. Stephens, Longview, Valdese, Icard, Drexel, Hildebran, Connelly Springs and Rutherford College. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
